hanzi-su-wiki:
労

Значения

Сочувствовать; труд

Мнемоника

Сокращение. Напрягать силы 力, на ночной работе, при свете костров (огни превратились в точки ). Изнурение. Сочувствовать (тем, кто тяжко трудится).

Варианты

勞, 劳
purpleculture_pinyin:
láo
Japanese variant of 劳
Японский вариант лаосского языка
rtega_mnemonic:
労労RSlabor, toil, do manual work
  • result of force 力 crowned with a decorated shop 龸: do manual work or labor resulting in profits
heisig_constituent: labor, schoolhouse, owl, crown, power, muscle, arnold
Keyword_KANJIDIC: labor, thank for, reward for, toil, trouble
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: труд, спасибо за, вознаграждение за тяжелый труд, проблемы,
koohiiStory1: Those jocks who always tried to show their muscles in the schoolhouse are now the ones out there doing manual labor jobs while we sit here and learn Japanese. Ha!
koohiiStory2: At the schoolhouse, the administration develops the children´s muscles by making them do manual labour.
kunYomi: ろう.する、いたわ.る、いた.ずき、ねぎら、つか.れる、ねぎら.う
jp_example_words:
労る(いたわる): to pity, to sympathize with, to console, to care for, to be kind to
過労(かろう): overwork, strain
勤労(きんろう): labor, exertion, diligent service
ご苦労様(ごくろうさま): Thank you very much for your....
疲労(ひろう): fatigue, weariness
労力(ろうりょく): labour, effort, toil, trouble
苦労(くろう): troubles, hardships
労働(ろうどう): manual labor, toil, work
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A Viking in a position of power does not need to labor in the fields. Labor is for the weak! A Viking of power takes what he wants, and need not labor for it. A powerful Viking plunders all and takes what he wants!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine yourself as a powerful Viking. You have the power to take anything you want, pillaging and plundering to your heart’s content. Imagine all the things you would acquire with this sort of power.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: It takes a lot of labor to harvest roe (ろう) so that’s what the Viking decides to take first! Roe is delicious, but it’s small and delicate. Vikings don’t labor for their own roe! They take it and eat it!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture this powerful Viking laying siege on a small fishing village and taking all the roe and stuffing it into his bearded face. So much labor went into harvesting that roe! Vikings are so mean!
Ru_Meaning: labor, thank for, reward for, toil, trouble
Kanshudo_mnemonic: you make an effort (力) in the classroom (龸) to labor

láo
яп. вм. 劳
Radicals: 力  (power, viking)
Meaning Mnemonic
A Viking in a position of power does not need to labor in the fields. Labor is for the weak! A Viking of power takes what he wants, and need not labor for it. A powerful Viking plunders all and takes what he wants!
Imagine yourself as a powerful Viking. You have the power to take anything you want, pillaging and plundering to your heart’s content. Imagine all the things you would acquire with this sort of power.
Reading Mnemonic
It takes a lot of labor to harvest roe (ろう) so that’s what the Viking decides to take first! Roe is delicious, but it’s small and delicate. Vikings don’t labor for their own roe! They take it and eat it!
Picture this powerful Viking laying siege on a small fishing village and taking all the roe and stuffing it into his bearded face. So much labor went into harvesting that roe! Vikings are so mean!
